channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: If you’re a fundamentalist, you’ll believe God will ultimately settle all the accounts so mothers dying in childbirth really isn’t all that bad. https://t.co/NqAeyFZJoT
@brianbeutler What’s your theory? Old and out of touch and unable to adapt? Or desperately hoping to avoid a show trial and public execution under the next Republican administration?

Your occasional reminder that the Orthodox magazines that claim to follow an editorial long set by “Torah leaders” repeatedly whitewash this cult of criminals. https://t.co/XY72NcCPR4
It is really hard to overstate how little discernment “Torah sages” actually have, and how many people suffer because they fall victim to the mistaken belief that knowing how to read ancient Jewish texts make you smarter.

@EladNehorai Gonna be lots more going through it when the #RogueSCOTUS opens the money floodgates to religious schools next month!
@EladNehorai Good for book sales in coming decades, except in states where they fall afoul of newly-Constitutional blasphemy laws.
@passwordismiket @ashleyfeinberg When a dinosaur loves a truck very much…
@RachelSchine As it is written: “Boys will be boys, but girls will be gilled.”
Before you weigh in on defunding the police, please read this thread. https://t.co/VZw94sk0Pt
@N_S_Dolkart Related: https://t.co/MqLDYCudMN
@tompeyer Where’s Henry Kissinger when you need him?
@tompeyer I’m pushing 60, but she’s making me appreciate the wisdom of the political philosophy of Logan’s Run.
@rev_avocado Good thing he’s not trying this in Chicago where the dead can vote. Because I understand lots of the recently dead in NYS have a bone to pick with the younger Cuomo.
@johnastoehr So they’ve previously opined on the state level bans on trans treatments?
@rmneiss Pretty clear from the beginning of Genesis….
@AkivaMCohen But credit for republishing the allegedly defamatory speech on her own Substack! Talk about living “retweets are not endorsements”!
Today in the anti-trans/anti-semite alliance. https://t.co/G5S2N2ZcGp
@rmneiss Looking forward to his interview in some former Times editor’s Substack.

@onthemainline What stunned me was his inability to pivot and take advantage of the unparalleled platform he had earned — nationwide live broadcast of a speech. Instead he simply insulted the majority of his audience.
@onthemainline Whose line was that?
@onthemainline Rav Shach would have approved of the headline.

@unidentifedbird Not true at all. In the ideal world known as Oz, as described by L Frank Baum in The Marvelous Land of Oz at the dawn of the 20th century, you could become fluent in a language (or any other field of study) just by taking a pill.

“[S]he is indeed a virtuoso of hate, and thus do pogroms begin." -Gore Vidal responding referring to Midge Dector following her essay “The Boys on the Beach.” Worth revisiting as her heirs embrace Ron DrSantis. https://t.co/yQYnbqVrbv

@nagaijin @HeerJeet “"[S]he is indeed a virtuoso of hate, and thus do pogroms begin." -Gore Vidal in that essay. https://t.co/YHDVxvSDEC
@nagaijin @HeerJeet I do hope she lived long enough to see John claim to be evicted by the NY Holocaust Museum for the crime of trying to give a homophobic politician a platform there. https://t.co/YP3pDrSlrO
@roripn @datadivajf One more of the sins of Isaac Asimov ז״ל.

Actually, I suspect there’s a fair amount of Just Revolution theory, theology, and probably international law that is relevant to the situation. https://t.co/DDOfonsfGJ
In terms of my very limited knowledge of history, the situation in Lebanon, where a constitution came to enshrine minority rule, is certainly a relevant precedent.
@That_Musician If you read the other replies to my tweet, you’ll see it was not the Steinsaltz translator the Lakewood rabbi objected to, but one of the other commentaries on the site.
